      • buildAnnotations

        public static <T extends Annotation> Iterable<T> buildAnnotations(Iterable<? extends AnnotationBuilder<T>> builders)
        Adapts between AnnotationBuilder instances and Annotation.
        Parameters:
        builders - A list of AnnotationBuilder objects ready to build into annotations.
        Returns:
        An iterable that lazily calls build on each AnnotationBuilder to construct its annotation.

      • buildAnnotations

        public static <T extends Annotation> Iterator<T> buildAnnotations(Iterator<? extends AnnotationBuilder<T>> builders)
        Adapts between AnnotationBuilder instances and Annotation.
        Parameters:
        builders - An iteration of AnnotationBuilder objects ready to build into annotations.
        Returns:
        An iterator that lazily calls build on each AnnotationBuilder to construct its annotation.

      • wrapCharSequence

        public static DocumentContent wrapCharSequence(CharSequence sequence)
        Adapts between a CharSequence instance and DocumentContent. This can be used to wrap a Java String in a format suitable for uploading either as ephemeral predictions or for permanent storage under server- assigned names.
        Parameters:
        sequence - A CharSequence
        Returns:
        DocumentContent facade for sequence

      • wrapCharSequences

        public static Iterable<DocumentContent> wrapCharSequences(Iterable<? extends CharSequence> sequences)
        Adapts between CharSequence instances and DocumentContent. This can be used to wrap Java Strings in a format suitable for uploading either as ephemeral predictions or for permanent storage under server- assigned names.
        Parameters:
        sequences - An iteration of CharSequence instances.
        Returns:
        An iterable that lazily wraps each CharSequence in a DocumentContent facade

      • wrapCharSequences

        public static Iterator<DocumentContent> wrapCharSequences(Iterator<? extends CharSequence> sequences)
        Adapts between CharSequence instances and DocumentContent. This can be used to wrap Java Strings in a format suitable for uploading either as ephemeral predictions or for permanent storage under server- assigned names.
        Parameters:
        sequences - An iteration of CharSequence instances.
        Returns:
        An iterator that lazily wraps each CharSequence in a DocumentContent facade
